description.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygiene especially for the most deprived communities

sector.narrative: HSS - Risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Sanitation - eliminating open defecation in peri-urban and urban communities
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water supply - peri-urban and urban communities service delivery
Water supply - rural communities service delivery
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities disaster prevention and preparedness
Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration
Water supply and Sanitation rural sanitation

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in India (Adolescent Development and Participation)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2017 India: Reducing Stunting in Children Under Five Years of Age: a comprehensive evaluation of UNICEF’s strategies and programme performance – India Country Case Study
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygiene especially for the most deprived communities

No. of states with monitoring frameworks for sanitation and hygiene service delivery (emphasises achievement of targets, actions and budget lines that demonstrate reach to the most deprived communities, and with reliable national verification)

baseline.value: Not all states have all aspects of the national guidelines currently in place

target.value: 2017:15 states meet all aspects of the National Guidelines

actual.value: 2014:2. This indicator is constrained as a result of the slow if steady progress governments are making in implementing the sanitation programme. title.narrative: No. of states implementing national sanitation guidelines

baseline.value: Some or no states have all aspects of the guidelines currently in place

target.value: 2017:15 states meet all aspects of the National Guidelines

actual.value: 2014:1. In 2014 the three states without a state SHACS, Bihar, Chhattisgarh, and Odisha have developed state SHACS, held state workshops and are now planning for roll-out.
